NEWS BITES

U.K. Government Urged to Overhaul Stamp Duty To Help Housing Market The average U.K. homebuyer pays £2,300 (US$2,952) in stamp duty when purchasing a property. The Centre for Policy Studies is urging the U.K. government to raise the threshold on the stamp tax from £125,000 to £500,000 to avoid impeding mobility and aspiration in the housing market. The government currently collects £5.1 billion per year from the stamp duty. City A.M.

Australian Developers Prefer High-Density Residential Areas Australia’s high-density residential areas comprised 73.1% of all sold development sites during the 2018-19 financial year, according to Knight Frank’s Australia Residential Development Review. Townhouse sites desired by the downsizing population and those who cannot afford single-dwelling homes on the east coast made up 6% of Australian development sites for the same time period. World Property Journal

Melbourne, Australia’s Home Prices Expected to Hit Peak By Next September Melbourne’s housing market is predicted to skyrocket almost 15% over the next year to hit a market peak—last set in November 2017—by September 2020, according to CoreLogic-Moody’s Analytics Australia Home Value Index Forecast. During the last peak, Melbourne’s median house price reached A$832,448 (US$568,247). Realestate.com.au

Smart Dubai Promotes Advanced Real Estate Technologies In U.A.E. Real estate portal Property Finder partnered with Smart Dubai to launch the Dubai Date Private Sector Strategy and Policy in order to develop new data products for the real estate market in Dubai. Smart Dubai’s goal is to introduce advanced technologies into the real estate industry to make purchasing a home easier, according to Younus Al Nasser, assistant director general of Dubai Smart City Office. Khaleej Times

Spokane, Washington, Tops the List of Cities With Best Value for Your Money House hunters are looking to move to Spokane, Washington, which is the city with the highest inbound-outbound ratio due to its affordability and burgeoning job market, according to Realtor.com. Over one-third of the population of house hunters considering a move to Spokane are from Seattle. realtor.com

The Kincade Fire in Northern California Has Displaced 180,000 Residents The area of northern California stretching from Sonoma County to the Pacific Ocean is now under mandatory evacuation for 180,000 residents as the Kincade Fire, only 5% contained, has already burned 54,200 acres. Pacific Gas and Electric is shutting down power for 2.3 million people. As of Saturday night, 31 residential homes had been burned. Curbed San Francisco
